answers.answer: Just try to relax. I know a lot of women that failed first and then passed. Lucky for you they gave you a second chance I on the other hand had a hospital visit and they tested my blood AFTER I ate all this starchy carb food and they just diagnosed me with GD so you have a chance. Its not that bad just don't eat anything after midnight do a little exercise before it if you stress out it will raise your glucose
That's the thing, I don't eat after midnight, I've only gain 4 or 5 pounds. And I made sure not to eat anything today. I just don't understand lol. Hopefully I'll pass the next one.
It has nothing to do with how much weight you've gained and so forth. I bet it does s uck though, good luck on your next test date

With my first I failed the first time had to do the long depressing 3 hrs all while I had the worst ear ache in the world plus I was sooooooo sleepy couldn't sleep eat or nothing smh I passed that time I was so annoyed I'm taking one for this pregnancy tomorrow and I'm praying I passed cause I don't got time to be in my doctors office for three hours I can't even stand being there for 30 minutes because they always **** me off
I failed mine by 3 points, the wouldn't allow me to do a 3 hour one. So they tried to make me do a diabetes check thing instead.
I failed my 1-hour, but I passed my 3-hour! don't stress.. I brought in ice chips for my 3-hour which made it a little easier, but you'll do fine! good luck! ((:
my sugar was elevated during my 1-hour so I had to take a three hour. but everything came back normal so it really just depends. no need to stress.

question: So.... I failed. I have to go back to do the 3hr depressed. I'm upset. Did anyone else fail the first time and pass the second. I went eight hours without eating only to freaking fail.
title: Glucose screening
